1.text: AND he said to his disciples: It is impossible that scandals should not come: but woe to him through whom they come.

2.text: It were better for him, that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should scandalize one of these little ones.

3.text: Take heed to yourselves. If thy brother sin against thee, reprove him: and if he do penance, forgive him.

4.text: And if he sin against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day be converted unto thee, saying, I repent; forgive him.

5.text: And the apostles said to the Lord: Increase our faith.

6.text: And the Lord said: If you had faith like to a grain of mustard seed, you might say to this mulberry tree, Be thou rooted up, and be thou transplanted into the sea: and it would obey you.

7.text: But which of you having a servant ploughing, or feeding cattle, will say to him, when he is come from the field: Immediately go, sit down to meat:

8.text: And will not rather say to him: Make ready my supper, and gird thyself, and serve me, whilst I eat and drink, and afterwards thou shalt eat and drink?

9.text: Doth he thank that servant, for doing the things which he commanded him?

10.text: I think not. So you also, when you shall have done all these things that are commanded you, say: We are unprofitable servants; we have done that which we ought to do.

11.text: And it came to pass, as he was going to Jerusalem, he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

12.text: And as he entered into a certain town, there met him ten men that were lepers, who stood afar off;

13.text: And lifted up their voice, saying: Jesus, master, have mercy on us.

14.text: Whom when he saw, he said: Go, shew yourselves to the priests. And it came to pass, as they went, they were made clean.

15.text: And one of them, when he saw that he was made clean, went back, with a loud voice glorifying God.

16.text: And he fell on his face before his feet, giving thanks: and this was a Samaritan.

17.text: And Jesus answering, said, Were not ten made clean? and where are the nine?

18.text: There is no one found to return and give glory to God, but this stranger.

19.text: And he said to him: Arise, go thy way; for thy faith hath made thee whole.

20.text: And being asked by the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come? he answered them, and said: The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:

21.text: Neither shall they say: Behold here, or behold there. For lo, the kingdom of God is within you.

22.text: And he said to his disciples: The days will come, when you shall desire to see one day of the Son of man; and you shall not see it.

23.text: And they will say to you: See here, and see there. Go ye not after, nor follow them:

24.text: For as the lightening that lighteneth from under heaven, shineth unto the parts that are under heaven, so shall the Son of man be in his day.

25.text: But first he must suffer many things, and be rejected by this generation.

26.text: And as it came to pass in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.

27.text: They did eat and drink, they married wives, and were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark: and the flood came and destroyed them all.

28.text: Likewise as it came to pass, in the days of Lot: they did eat and drink, they bought and sold, they planted and built.

29.text: And in the day that Lot went out of Sodom, it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.

30.text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man shall be revealed.

31.text: In that hour, he that shall be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away: and he that shall be in the field, in like manner, let him not return back.

33.text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life, shall lose it: and whosoever shall lose it, shall preserve it.

34.text: I say to you: in that night there shall be two men in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.

35.text: Two women shall be grinding together: the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left: two men shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be keft.

36.text: They answering, say to him: Where, Lord?

37.text: Who said to them: Wheresoever the body shall be, thither will the eagles also be gathered together.
